turn.0: ELI5 why gentrification is a bad thing?
turn.1: I used to study a topic that was very involved with the social justice scene and gentrification was seen as a bad thing because it displaces the poor / lower income folk leaving them with nowhere to go
turn.2: That seems to be more a problem caused by the US just being a dick to poor people than a specific fault of urban development.
turn.3: Well, if you're going to gentrify, you need a run down area to improve upon. Run down areas tend to be inhabited by those of lower socioeconomic status  So urban development kind of goes hand in hand.  Also gentrification isn't just seen as a bad thing in the US. I'm from Australia and gentrification is seen as a negative because of its effects on lower socioeconomic status people
turn.4: Honestly not a problem I expected Australia to have. Usually when I talk to Australians, they just tell me how much empty space the island is, so I guess I just always assumed you guys would just... expand?
turn.5: Also fun fact, the amazon rainforest lost 125,000 hectares due to fire in the month of August and we just recently lost 970,000 in a few days
